autoCommitInterval.description: The consumer will commit offsets after a given period, for example, five seconds
autoCommitInterval.title: Auto Commit Interval

jsonParseMessage.description: Whether to try to parse the message to an object
jsonParseMessage.title: JSON Parse Message

autoCommitThreshold.description: The consumer will commit offsets after resolving a given number of messages
autoCommitThreshold.title: Auto Commit Threshold

sessionTimeout.description: The time to await a response in ms
sessionTimeout.title: Session Timeout

maxInFlightRequests.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests the client will send on a single connection
maxInFlightRequests.title: Max Number of Requests

parallelProcessing.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order
parallelProcessing.title: Parallel Processing

returnHeaders.description: Whether to return the headers received from Kafka
returnHeaders.title: Return Headers

onlyMessage.description: Whether to return only the message property
onlyMessage.title: Only Message

allowAutoTopicCreation.description: Whether to allow sending message to a previously non exisiting topic
allowAutoTopicCreation.title: Allow Topic Creation

heartbeatInterval.description: Heartbeats are used to ensure that the consumer's session stays active
heartbeatInterval.title: Heartbeat Interval

fromBeginning.description: Whether to read message from beginning
fromBeginning.title: Read Messages From Beginning

useSchemaRegistry.description: Whether to use Confluent Schema Registry
useSchemaRegistry.title: Use Schema Registry

topic.description: Name of the queue of topic to consume from
topic.title: Topic

init_kwargs.title: Scade tools: Kafka Trigger
init_kwargs.description: Consume messages from a Kafka topic
